document.title: Oklahoma Academic Standards: English Language Arts

5A8D5597078F454389944B2BFDCC5110.description: Express their ideas using a combination of drawing and emergent writing with prompting.

35426D86318E46A8AA4AE1B25953E27A.description: Listen and respond to read-alouds, participate in shared reading, and interact independently with texts.

77C26A6B8049486F8C94079B5C029E97.description: Students will read and write independently for a variety of purposes and periods of time.

4E300E43060A4FE0ADA4FC8C5497D14E.description: Combine movement with relevant props, images, or illustrations to support their writing and speaking.

BB5EA199C73846F9ABDD565A195ED1BE.description: Explore ideas and topics in multimodal content.

4DCB5C2F124E43A7977DEAFFFE60D3E1.description: Students will comprehend and communicate knowledge through alphabetic, aural, visual, spatial, and/or gestural content.

B8F7DEF5D1F342B49B633F56A457BCE8.description: Share relevant information for various purposes with prompting.

55B4A92E426B45B8BF16264C08FE09C8.description: Find information from provided sources during group research with prompting.

08E9D6E1E3934CDFB7E702449B1075BE.description: Generate topics of interest and decide if a friend, teacher, or expert can answer their questions with prompting.

E2B8062F57E545078C1F66B38759CC36.description:
Identify and use graphic and text features to understand texts:
  • photos
  • illustrations
  • titles

0C514D1F03B14265B496E6B635653A97.description: Identify relevant pictures, charts, grade-level texts, or people as sources of information on a topic of interest.

77BDC9D510F0411E9548C9759E0599AF.description: Students will engage in inquiry to acquire, refine, and communicate accurate information.

556F571D1163493CB6A54B9C2258ADCB.description: Recognize and begin to use periods, question marks, and exclamation points.

C6D407B567E3445780A50662A6B02DD6.description: Capitalize their first name and the pronoun I with prompting.

87045675405B4C37A350DF965DF911DC.description: Begin to compose simple sentences that begin with a capital letter and conclude with an end mark.

08F1762CE36E43159CD66C50F69763F7.description:
Recognize parts of speech in sentences with prompting:
  • concrete objects as persons, places, or things (i.e., nouns)
  • words as actions (i.e., verbs)
  • color and size adjectives
  • the pronoun I
  • spatial and time relationships such as up , down , before , and after

6C5345C5B4704729B66284732D8D6A4D.description: Students will expand and apply knowledge of grammar, usage, mechanics, and style to comprehend texts and communicate effectively.

ADF8DE1C55F64DB89E7DB004D83C7EED.description: Use language according to purpose in shared writing experiences.

5702094E6BFF4DF8850E2D2DB6BE992B.description: Use new vocabulary to produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

4866EBA2B1C44BC58FA60A0625A1FAC8.description: Begin to acquire new vocabulary and relate new words to prior knowledge.

62A4A0557A734387B55F642E901A4656.description: Begin to develop an awareness of context clues through read-alouds and other text experiences.

EF75413DE8DC479EB787672AC7FF76A2.description: Name and sort familiar objects into categories based on similarities and differences with prompting.

C8D8A9C215F14C388BBE2C908FF3F372.description: Students will expand and apply their spoken and reading vocabularies to speak, read, and write effectively.

EDE5FFDBC6DD4A478BFCBDA2F507249E.description: Use drawing, labeling, and writing to tell a story, share information, or express an opinion with prompting.

8CFF0146D2834C23B8F30EEC18C3BC24.description: Describe characters and setting in a story with prompting.

228701CDBF494FC69E9389A73E439540.description: Ask and answer basic questions (e.g., who, what, where, and when) about texts, photographs, or illustrations during shared reading or other text experiences with prompting.

27F12F71C2F34732A3041F95E5719ACD.description: Describe the roles of an author and illustrator in various texts.

214766FBCE09435B967D4D65CDA8E274.description: Students will apply critical thinking skills to reading and writing.

9FC9F80ADDBF470F87336D8359DCC867.description: Share their stories/texts with authentic audiences.

869DF944B6574B708161F872BB227621.description: Add to their drawing and emergent writing.

8E0F107866F64D9EB1C7B7C237385296.description: Use appropriate spacing between letters and words in emergent writing.

A543D17E63F146749805097F2B4DB55C.description: Sequence the action or details of stories/texts with prompting.

BD81037CD5C04C9DB39867195D5FF0F1.description: Express themselves through drawing and emergent writing.

730C2F5EEE344EF7B4F84CD73F841C1F.description: Begin to retell facts and details from an informational text.

B666796A81074702A873259212BC4FFB.description: Sequence the plot (i.e., beginning, middle, and end) of a story with prompting.

8E61733959C94B8DA0A3068EF7E60F23.description: Discriminate between fiction and nonfiction text with prompting.

A6A8BA306BBC48BD8128781266825D0F.description: Identify the topic or main idea with a supporting detail of a text with prompting.

FBB73ED39D524F659015842990F7C0D9.description: Students will use a variety of recursive reading and writing processes.

2E3334EB3C544816B78F83E41A04E5CF.description: Represent all of the sounds in a Consonant/Vowel/Consonant (CVC) word logically in phonetic spelling (e.g., "kat" for cat or "fer" for fur ).

63951FFEDA7B46A09F6976FEE9FC4BC5.description: Represent major consonants logically in phonetic spelling (e.g., "lefnt" for elephant or "apl" for apple ).

F58E076BFEB14D3FB03C4362055270B5.description: Begin to develop a sight word vocabulary by decoding and reading regularly- and irregularly-spelled words in isolation and context with increasing automaticity.

63EC7854A4264B1B9E81689AC06E9528.description: Recite familiar texts (e.g., rhymes, songs, poetry, etc.).

943811B9DE2E4EE1AE022BF1FF79C2E8.description: Read their first and last name in print.

9397172217474F27AD20A2C65F07AB77.description: Blend letter sounds to decode simple Vowel/Consonant (VC) and Consonant/Vowel/Consonant (CVC) words (e.g., VC words = at , in , up ; CVC words = pat , hen , lot ).

5DFE20CF77D8444CBD596CF3126A15B2.description: Produce the sounds for short and long vowels and the most common sound for consonants (e.g., a = /ă/ & /ā/, f = /f/, s = /s/, x = /ks/).

EC3061C21C40469FB3E3573D6D2A42CB.description: Sequence the letters of the alphabet.

599990E556F94DBB89E87073C74EDE08.description: Name all uppercase and lowercase letters.

01EC931848F74FE5832FBB88D5394424.description: Correctly form letters to write their first and last name and most uppercase and lowercase letters correctly.

1731256CEDD64600A673105FB3EAA98D.description: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., capitalization of the first word, ending punctuation: period, exclamation point, question mark) with prompting.

572918F893C84E8192D0FD33E341165A.description: Recognize that written words are made up of letters and are separated by spaces.

6B8BCB4C553041508F7C2F139B0D489A.description: Recognize that print moves from top to bottom, left to right, and front to back.

C4465841B89941C599DF7B731EDD905B.description: Demonstrate correct book orientation and identify the title, title page, and the front and back covers of a book.

69C91A00BE284349A9351C770FF99C9F.description: Demonstrate their understanding that print carries a message by recognizing labels, signs, and other print in the environment.

304E53719E8B4089979004A33E6ADE5F.description: Segment phonemes in one-syllable spoken words with 2-4 phonemes (e.g., flat = /f/ /l/ /a/ /t/).

56056F3391344052B12D31142A8B68F6.description: Blend phonemes to form one-syllable spoken words with 2-4 phonemes (e.g., /f/ /l/ /a/ /t/= flat ).

50C7B72104B541B49F4A0DCAABE73D8B.description: Blend and segment onset and rime in one-syllable spoken words (e.g., blending: /j/ + og = jog ; segmenting: cat = /c/+ at).

6B750ED90776493391ED4CEA34DEF91E.description: Count, segment, and blend syllables in spoken words.

8C18543391D245A787F146C53712F1B4.description: Isolate and pronounce initial and final sounds in spoken words.

113ABC4C5767488E8687E2FE052F5456.description: Distinguish rhyming and non-rhyming pairs and produce a rhyme when given a word.

FA1B0F2FCB6E403EA394276C7863516A.description: Count one-syllable and multisyllabic spoken words in a sentence (e.g., I see an elephant.).

E1937DBBA4E44544961F16801A3A3E0F.description: Students will develop foundational skills for reading and writing proficiency by working with sounds, letters, and text.

CEFCA31B2B654E9F85C9C4183641032F.description: Orally describe personal interests or tell stories to peers and adults using agreed-upon rules (e.g., taking turns, staying on topic).

4757922566FD4C3FA388A5E7F641F3D5.description: Ask and answer relevant questions with prompting.

B8EA710B23554E1EAC261A8DAA21DE2A.description: Engage in collaborative discussions about various topics and texts, including their own writing, with peers and adults in small and large groups with prompting.

F067DC6702754FC98D33C2745BCE8A37.description: Work respectfully with peers with prompting.

526F22257A40450B9938AA4C64ABC330.description: Follow simple one- and two-step oral directions.

C9EEC54B8F5C47EFBEBA63C2EEB41A84.description: Actively listen using agreed-upon discussion rules with prompting.

61792F57233543D389130C4E7F4A4399.description: Students will listen and speak effectively in a variety of situations.
